What is the output of the given Ruby code:

Code

def func1(str)
  n=4
  temp=Array.new(5) { Array.new(3) { 0 } }
  i=0
  j=0
  while i<n+1
    while j<3
      temp[i][j]=-1
      j+=1
    end
    i+=1
  end
  res=0
  i=0
  while i<n
    if str[i]=='0'
      res+=1
    else
      res+=func2(i,0,str,temp)
    end
    i+=1
  end
  return res
end  

def func2(i,m,str,temp)
  if i==str.length
    return 0
  end
  if temp[i][m]!=-1
    return temp[i][m]
  end
  x=str[i].to_i
  if ((x+m)%3==0) and x%2==0
    res=1+func2(i+1,(m+x)%3,str,temp)
  else
    res=func2(i+1,(m+x)%3,str,temp)
  end
  temp[i][m]=res
  return temp[i][m]
end

str="4806"
res=func1(str)
puts res

What is the output of the given Ruby code:

Code

def func1(str,n)
  i=0
  while i<n and str[i]=='0'
    i+=1
  end
  while i<n
    if str[i]=='0'
      return true
    end
    i+=1
  end
  return false
end

str1="2223"
str2="63"
res1=func1(str1,4)
res2=func1(str1,2)
puts res1
puts res2

Output

  1. true
false

     

  2. false
false

     

  3. true
true

     

  4. false
true

What is the output of the given Ruby code:

Code

def func1(str1,str2,m,n)
  temp=Array.new(7){Array.new(8){0}}
  i=0
  while i<=m
    j=0
    while j<=n
      if i==0||j==0
        temp[i][j]=0
      elsif str1[i-1]==str2[j-1]
        temp[i][j]=temp[i-1][j-1]+1
      else
        if temp[i-1][j]>temp[i][j-1]
          temp[i][j]=temp[i-1][j]
        else
          temp[i][j]=temp[i][j-1]
        end
      end
      j+=1
    end
    i+=1
  end
  return temp[m][n]
end

str1="BMNBDNA"
str2="AMBNCAR"
m=6
n=7
res=func1(str1,str2,m,n)
puts res

a=[1,3,4,2,5,7,9,8]
n=8
temp=0

What is the output of the given Ruby code:

Code

def func1(a,n)
  if n==1
    return 0
  end
  i=0
  while i<n-1
    if a[i]!=0 and a[i]==a[i+1]
      a[i]=2*a[i]
      a[i+1]=0
      i+=1
    end
    i+=1
  end
  func2(a,n)
end
def func2(a,n)
  temp=0
  i=0
  while i<n
    if a[i]!=0
      a[temp+1]=a[i]
      temp+=1
    end
    i+=1
  end
  while temp<n
    a[temp+1]=0
    temp+=1
  end
end

a=[0,2,2,3,0,4,6,2,0,0,8]
n=11
res=func1(a,n)
i=0
while i<n
  print a[i]
  print " "
  i+=1
end

What is the output of the given Ruby code:

Code

a=[2,7,9,5,8,7,4]
n=7
k=5
temp=0
i=0
while i<n
  if a[i]<=k
    temp+=1
  end
  i+=1
end
temp1=0
i=0
while i<temp
  if a[i]>k
    temp1+=1
  end
  i+=1
end
res=temp1
i=0
j=temp
while j<n
  if a[i]>k
    temp1-=1
  end
  if a[j]>k
    temp1+=1
  end
  if res>temp1
    res=temp1
  end
  i+=1
  j+=1
end
puts res

end

      count+=1
    end
    i+=1

What is the output of the given Ruby code:

Code

def meth1(a)
  if a==0
    return 1
  else
    if a%2!=0
      return (a+3)*meth1(a-1)
    else
      return (a-1)*meth1(a-3)
    end
  end
end

x=4
res=meth1(x)
puts res

What is the output of the given Ruby code:

Code

def meth1(a)
  if a==0
    return 1
  else
    if a%2==0
      return 5*(a-1)*meth1(a-3)
    else
      return (a)*meth1(a-1)
    end
  end
end

x=8
res=meth1(x)
puts res

What is the output of the given Ruby code:

Code

def meth1(x)
  if x<3
    return x
  end
  if x>=3 and x<10
    return x-1
  end
  temp=1
  while x/temp>9
    temp=temp*10
  end
  temp1=x/temp
  if temp1!=3
    return meth1(temp1)*meth1(temp-1)+meth1(temp1)+meth1(x%temp)
  else
    return meth1(temp1*temp-1)
  end
end

x=846
res=meth1(x)
puts res

What is the output of the given Ruby code:

Code

def func1(x)
  temp=0
  i=1
  while i<=x
    temp=temp+func2(i)
    i+=1
  end
  return temp
end

def func2(x)
  if x<=0
    return 0
  else
    if x%2==0
      return 0+func2(x/2)
    else
      return 1+func2(x/2)
    end
  end
end

x=4
res=func1(x)
puts res

What is the output of the given Ruby code if the file doesn't exist:

Code

begin
   puts 10/0
   File.open("somefile.txt")
rescue SystemCallError
   puts "File not found"
rescue StandardError
   puts "Exception"
rescue ZeroDivisionError
   puts "Divide by zero"
ensure
   print "Ensure block"
end

Output

  1. Divide by zero
Ensure block

     

  2. Exception
Ensure block

     

  3. File not found
Exception
Divide by zero
Ensure block

a.option: Other error will be shown and "Ensure block" will be printed

What is the output of the given Ruby code:

Code

class Class1

    def initialize
        @name = "Class1"
    end

    private

     def func2
         puts "result1"
     end

    protected

     def func3
         puts "result2"
     end

    public

     def get_name
         return @name
     end
end


class Class2 < Class1

    def func1
        func2
        func3
    end
end

d = Class2.new
d.func1
puts d.get_name

Output

  1. result2
result1
Class1

     

  2. Class1
result1
result2

     

  3. result1
result2
Class1

What is the output of the given Ruby code:

Code

class Class1

    @@temp = 0

    def initialize
        @@temp += 1
        puts "Class1"
    end

    def show_count
        "#{@@temp}"
    end

end

class Class2 < Class1

   def initialize
       super
       puts "Class2"
   end
end

class Class3 < Class1

   def initialize
       super
       puts "Class3"
   end
end

class Class4 < Class3

   def initialize
       super
       puts "Class4"
   end
end

Class2.new
d = Class4.new
puts d.show_count

Output

Class2
Class1
Class3
Class4
2

     

  2. Class1
Class2
Class3
Class4
1

     

  3. Class1
Class2
Class3
Class4
2

     

  4. Class1
Class1
Class2
Class1
Class3
Class3
Class4
3

  return nil   
end

  sleep 0.5   
end   
puts "End"

You need to write a program to create a thread that has a method with the code of that thread say func1(). In that, you need to while loop with the sleep method of 1 sec and then increment value 'x' from 0 till 3 (inclusive). Then create an instance thread and start that. The Ruby code given is not correct:

Code

def func1
   x = 0
   while x < 3
      sleep("1sec")
   end
end

t = new func1(Thread)
t.start

Which of the following option indicates the correct code:

Options

  1. def func1
   x = 0
   while x < 3
      sleep(1)
      x = x + 1
   end
end

t = Thread.new{func1()}
t.start

     

  2. def func1
   x = 0
   while x <= 3
      sleep(1)
      x = x + 1
   end
end

t = Thread.new{func1()}
t.join

     

  3. def func1
   x = 0
   while x <= 3
      sleep("1sec")
      x=x+1
   end
end

t = new func1(Thread)
t.join

     

  4. def func1
   x = 0
   while x <= 3
      sleep("1sec")
   end
end

t = Thread.new{func1()}
t.join

What is the output of the following code in Ruby:
